UDA Synthetic Enzymes Resource Supply.description: The UDA Synthetic Enzymes Resource Supply pack is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Prospectors can also research, purchase, and request UDA Synthetic Enzymes Resource Supply packs using anOrbital Exchange Interface.

UltraMeal.name: UltraMeal
UltraMeal.description: UltraMeal is aFoodwith a uniqueStatus Effect: 'Emergency Rations'. Can be eaten to satisfyHunger. It is a one time use emergency ration to stave off starvation.

Viscid Trophy.name: Viscid Trophy
Viscid Trophy.description: Viscid Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete theBestiary, it can also be used in tandem with otherFurnitureto increase theCozinessof your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of theWell Rested Buff.

Vitamins.name: Vitamins
Vitamins.description: Vitamins are a late-gameTier 4preventativeMedicinethat increases resistance to a number of conditions and is useful in allBiomes. It does not consume a stomach slot so it can be combined with otherFoodbuffs.

Volatile Substance.name: Volatile Substance
Volatile Substance.description: Volatile Substance is a precursor resource used in making explosiveAmmunitionand weapons like theFrag Grenade. Volatile Substance is highly unstable and has a spoil timer of 600 seconds. Once spoiled, the item will then becomeInert Volatile Substance.

Volcanic Animal Feed.name: Volcanic Animal Feed
Volcanic Animal Feed.description: Volcanic Animal Feed is aAnimal FeedforPetsorMountswith a uniqueStatus Effect. Can be fed to mounts to satisfyHunger. Volcanic Animal Feed decays in 10,800 seconds, but that decay can be slowed down by storing Volcanic Animal Feed inside anIce BoxorRefrigerator.

Water.name: Water
Water.description: Water is a basic resource needed for survival on Icarus. It may be consumed by drinking from natural water sources such as lakes, streams, and pools found inCaves. Water from these natural sources is Tainted Water and has a 15% chance of causing dysentery. Water has various levels of purity depending on source and means of filtering. A status icon is displayed to indicate the type and status of water the prospector has consumed.

Watering Can.name: Watering Can
Watering Can.description: The Watering Can is a mid-gameToolused to water multiple crop plots/dirt mounds simultaneously. Prospectors can unlock it inTier 2portion of theTech Treeafter reaching Level 20. The Watering Can hold 5.0 L and can be used five times before needing to be refilled.

Watermelon Farming Packet.name: Watermelon Farming Packet
Watermelon Farming Packet.description: The Watermelon Farming Packet is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five Watermelon seeds, which then can be planted inDirt Moundsor Crop plots to growPlant Resources.

Watermelon Lollypop.name: Watermelon Lollypop
Watermelon Lollypop.description: Watermelon Lollypop is a consumable food that provides a quick burst of energy to reduce movement speed penalties.

Waterskin.name: Waterskin
Waterskin.description: Filled at any water source, including aRain Reservoir.

Water Barrel.name: Water Barrel
Water Barrel.description: Water Barrels are a deployable that can be connected to a water network to store 300,000 water and can output 1,000 water per second to keep the network operational.

Water Bomb.name: Water Bomb
Water Bomb.description: The Water Bomb is aTier 2item that will aid Prospectors in extinguishing fires. Once thrown, the Water Bomb will douse the area in water, putting out any fires. Stacks up to 5.

Water Pipe Tool.name: Water Pipe Tool
Water Pipe Tool.description: The Water Pipe Tool connects theBiofuel Water Pump/Electric Water PumptoDeployables/Water Storageto provideWater.

Water Purifier.name: Water Purifier
Water Purifier.description: Water Purifiers can be crafted from the Machining Bench with the following resources once the appropriate blueprint point has been spent:

Water Sprinkler.name: Water Sprinkler
Water Sprinkler.description: The Water Sprinkler will provide fire suppression when connected to aWater Networkwith aWater Pipe Tool. Can be manually activated by damaging it or by pressing F to water nearbyDirt Mounds/Crop Plotsor to apply theWetmodifier to nearby prospectors and deployables, which can help counter heatwaves inDeserts.

Water Treatment Pill.name: Water Treatment Pill
Water Treatment Pill.description: Water Treatment Pills remove the risk of dysentery from Tainted and Rainwater. Use with any canteen of water using the Character Crafting interface

Water Trough.name: Water Trough
Water Trough.description: The Water Trough is a basic trough used to keepMountsandPetshydrated. Can be filled using aLiquid Containerfilled withWateror by leaving it exposed to the elements.

Water Wheel.name: Water Wheel
Water Wheel.description: The Water Wheel is a power-generating device that can be placed in any flowing body of water. Use anElectricity Toolto connect it toBenchesto provide power.

Wheat Farming Packet.name: Wheat Farming Packet
Wheat Farming Packet.description: The Wheat Farming Packet is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five Wheat seeds, which then can be planted inDirt Moundsor Crop plots to growPlant Resources.

White Jelly Lure.name: White Jelly Lure
White Jelly Lure.description: The White Jelly Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. Like allLures, the White Jelly Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

White Jerky.name: White Jerky
White Jerky.description: White Jerky is aFoodwith a uniqueStatus Effect, which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfyHunger.

Wild Boar Bait.name: Wild Boar Bait
Wild Boar Bait.description: Wild Boar Bait is a single-useCrafted Resourceused to attract and captureWild Boarswhen used with aSnare Trap. Wild Boar Bait does not decay and can only be used inForestandGrasslandBiomes. Stacks up to ten.

Wild Boar Trophy.name: Wild Boar Trophy
Wild Boar Trophy.description: Wild Boar Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete theBestiary, it can also be used in tandem with otherFurnitureto increase theCozinessof your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of theWell Rested Buff.

Wild Salad.name: Wild Salad
Wild Salad.description: Wild Salad is aFoodwith a uniqueStatus Effect, which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfyHunger.

Windmill.name: Windmill
Windmill.description: The Windmill is a fasterTier 3equivalent of theMortar and Pestleand an intermediate item before reaching theMaterial ProcessoronTier 4.

Wind Turbine.name: Wind Turbine
Wind Turbine.description: The Wind Turbine is a power generating device that must be placed outdoors. It provides 1,750 units ofpowerwhen active and must also be placed in an area clear of obstructions for it to function. Use anElectricity Toolto connect it toBenchesto provide power.

Wine.name: Wine
Wine.description: Wine is a mid-game beverage brewed fromWild BerryandReed Flowerthat greatly increases stamina and stamina regeneration.

Wolf Bait.name: Wolf Bait
Wolf Bait.description: Wolf Bait is aCrafted Resourceused to attract and capture wild wolves. It is a single-use item that is used with aSnare Trapand allows prospectors to tameWolves/Snow Wolves. Wolf Bait does not decay and can only be used inForest,GrasslandandArcticBiomes. Stacks up to ten.

Wolf Lure.name: Wolf Lure
Wolf Lure.description: The Wolf Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone increase is the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like allLures, the Wolf Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Wolf Rug.name: Wolf Rug
Wolf Rug.description: Wolf Rugs are decorative deployables that can be placed on any ground surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from being for decorative purposes, it can also be used in tandem with otherFurnitureto increase theCozinessof your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of theWell Rested Buff.

Wolf Trophy.name: Wolf Trophy
Wolf Trophy.description: Wolf Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete theBestiary, it can also be used in tandem with otherFurnitureto increase theCozinessof your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of theWell Rested Buff.

Workshop Repair Kit.name: Workshop Repair Kit
Workshop Repair Kit.description: The Workshop Repair Kit is obtained by purchasing aWorkshop Repair Kit Bundlefrom theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand consuming the bundle. Workshop Repair Kits can be used to repair Workshop Items at a poweredRepair Bench.

Workshop Repair Kit Bundle.name: Workshop Repair Kit Bundle
Workshop Repair Kit Bundle.description: The Workshop Repair Kit Bundle is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Station. Once opened, this bundle gives the Prospector fiveWorkshop Repair Kits that can be used to repairOrbital Workshop Tools/Weapons/Armorat a poweredRepair Bench.

World Boss Module.name: World Boss Module
World Boss Module.description: The World Boss Module is researched and crafted on theSpace Stationin theWorkshop. Must be equipped in a envirosuit module slot after dropping into a Prospect.

Worm Scale.name: Worm Scale
Worm Scale.description: Worm Scales are a resource that drops fromCaveworms. Only after completingUnearthed: Researchcan these scales andPoison Sacksbe used to craft new weaponry at aCrafting Bench.

Xenon Backpack.name: Xenon Backpack
Xenon Backpack.description: The Xenon Backpack is designed to aid prospectors in hunting and vestige gathering, granting prospectors the ability to harvest vestiges from animals without needing to use aTaxidermy Knife; an excellent choice for those seeking to complete theBestiary.

Xigo Puri-tab.name: Xigo Puri-tab
Xigo Puri-tab.description: Xigo Puri-tab is purchased in theWorkshopon theSpace Station. The purification tablet will convert anyWaterto Treated Water in a canteen orLiquid Container. The recipe for purifying water should be available in your characterCraftingmenu when you have a filled canteen and a Xigo Puri-tab in your inventory.

Xigo Quick-Fix Bundle.name: Xigo Quick-Fix Bundle
Xigo Quick-Fix Bundle.description: The Xigo Quick-Fix Bundle provides 5Xigo Quick-Fix Kitsthat act asMedicineto heal various types of wounds and remove afflictions.

Xigo Quick-Fix Kit.name: Xigo Quick-Fix Kit
Xigo Quick-Fix Kit.description: The Xigo Quick-Fix Kit is a consumableMedicinethat heals wounds and removes certainStatus Effects.

Xigo SplintX.name: Xigo SplintX
Xigo SplintX.description: Xigo SplintX is a consumable medicine to heal a Broken Leg or SprainStatus Effectand provide a +10% Falling Resistance for a duration of 5 minutes.

Xigo SplintX Bundle.name: Xigo SplintX Bundle
Xigo SplintX Bundle.description: The Xigo SplintX Bundle provides 5Xigo SplintXsthat act asMedicineto heal a Sprain or Broken LegStatus Effectand provide +10% Falling Resistance.

Yeast Farming Packet.name: Yeast Farming Packet
Yeast Farming Packet.description: The Yeast Farming Packet is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five Yeast seeds, which then can be planted inDirt Moundsor Crop plots to growPlant Resources.

Yeast Lure.name: Yeast Lure
Yeast Lure.description: The Yeast Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. Like allLures, the Yeast Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Zebra Trophy.name: Zebra Trophy
Zebra Trophy.description: Zebra Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete theBestiary, it can also be used in tandem with otherFurnitureto increase theCozinessof your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of theWell Rested Buff.

Advanced Iron Lure.name: Advanced Iron Lure
Advanced Iron Lure.description: The Advanced Iron Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone size increase widens the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like allLures, the Advanced Iron Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Aluminium Ingot.name: Aluminium Ingot
Aluminium Ingot.description: Aluminium Ingot is the refined resource crafted fromAluminium Ore.

Cold Steel Bolt.name: Cold Steel Bolt
Cold Steel Bolt.description: The Cold Steel Bolt is ammunition used with aCrossbow. In addition to projectile damage, it has a chance to inflict a Freeze modifier that slows and damages enemies.

Cold Steel Ingot.name: Cold Steel Ingot
Cold Steel Ingot.description: Cold Steel Ingots are a refined resource crafted fromSteel IngotsandSuper Cooled Ice. Prospectors must use aConcrete Furnaceor anElectric Furnaceto refine the resources listed below into a Cold Steel Ingot.

Cold Steel Javelin.name: Cold Steel Javelin
Cold Steel Javelin.description:
The Cold Steel Javelin is a variant of theCold Steel Spearthat can only be thrown. Deals frost damage on hit and has a 15% chance to apply a unique debuff to targets while dealing periodic frost damage. Excels when used against Fauna that have a weakness to frost. A list of Fauna that are weak to frost can be viewedhere. When the Freeze modifier does proc, periodic frost damage is dealt to the target over the span of 10 seconds.
Fauna with:

Copper Attachment.name: Copper Attachment
Copper Attachment.description: Copper Attachment is a mid-to-end game item available once the prospector has unlocked theTool Attachment Packtech.

Copper Bolt.name: Copper Bolt
Copper Bolt.description: The Copper Bolt is ammunition used with aCrossbow. Like arrows and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Copper Cluster Lamp.name: Copper Cluster Lamp
Copper Cluster Lamp.description: The Copper Cluster Lamp is a simple low output lamp that does not require fuel to operate but does require water to craft.

Copper Geode Lamp.name: Copper Geode Lamp
Copper Geode Lamp.description: The Copper Geode Lamp is a simple low output lamp that does not require fuel to operate but does require water to craft.

Copper Ingot.name: Copper Ingot
Copper Ingot.description: Copper Ingot is the refined resource crafted fromCopper Ore.

Copper Monolith Lamp.name: Copper Monolith Lamp
Copper Monolith Lamp.description: The Copper Monolith Lamp is a simple low output lamp that does not require fuel to operate but does require water to craft.

Copper Nail.name: Copper Nail
Copper Nail.description: Copper Nail are used widely in crafting of items such as interiorInterior Wood Building Pieces, and other items made ofRefined Woodat theCarpentry BenchandMachining Bench.

Copper Wire.name: Copper Wire
Copper Wire.description: Copper Wire is used in a variety of high-end buildings and components and is crafted in batches of 5.

Deluxe Leather Saddle.name: Deluxe Leather Saddle
Deluxe Leather Saddle.description: The Deluxe Leather Saddle is a saddle forMountsmade with cured leather. It is available as part of theCreature Comforts DLCand is a cosmetic change to theBasic Riding Saddlethat provides no additional attributes.

Iron Bolt.name: Iron Bolt
Iron Bolt.description: The Iron Bolt is ammunition used with aCrossbow. Like arrows and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Iron Cupboard.name: Iron Cupboard
Iron Cupboard.description: The Iron Cupboard comes with 50 inventory slots and can be used to safely store valuable resources. Unlike theWood Cupboard, it does not require shelter and can be placed outside without risk of taking damage during storms.

Iron Ingot.name: Iron Ingot
Iron Ingot.description: Iron Ingot is the refined resource crafted fromIron Oreand is one of the most used materials in theTier 2Tech Tree and beyond.

Iron Javelin.name: Iron Javelin
Iron Javelin.description: The Iron Javelin is a variant of theIron Spearthat can only be thrown and is an upgrade over the Tier 1 Javelins.

Iron Lure.name: Iron Lure
Iron Lure.description: The Iron Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. Like allLures, the Iron Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Iron Nail.name: Iron Nail
Iron Nail.description: Iron Nail are used widely in crafting of items such asStone Building Pieces, andIron Tools.

Iron Shears.name: Iron Shears
Iron Shears.description: The Iron Shears are use to shearSheepto obtainWool. Can cause 30-40 Melee damage

Iron Sickle.name: Iron Sickle
Iron Sickle.description: Used by 'attacking' plants such as shrubs,Reed Flower,Wheat, etc. Sickles significantly increase the yield of plants when harvesting.

Leather Attachment.name: Leather Attachment
Leather Attachment.description: Leather Attachment is a mid-to-end game item available once the prospector has unlocked theTool Attachment Packtech.

Leather Backpack.name: Leather Backpack
Leather Backpack.description: The Leather Backpack is a must need when mining ores, or taking long trips across Icarus, fit everything you need inside for survival!

Medium Iron Crate.name: Medium Iron Crate
Medium Iron Crate.description: A Medium Iron Crate, use it to safely store valuable resources. Unlike theMedium Wood Crate, it does not require shelter and can be placed outside (immune to storm damage).

Platinum Ingot.name: Platinum Ingot
Platinum Ingot.description: Platinum Ingot is the refined resource crafted fromPlatinum Ore.

Refined Gold.name: Refined Gold
Refined Gold.description: Refined Gold is the refined resource crafted fromGold Ore.

Refined Wood.name: Refined Wood
Refined Wood.description: Refined Wood is used for the construction ofInterior Wood Buildings, Refined Wood Deployables, and various Tools.

Refined Wood Lure.name: Refined Wood Lure
Refined Wood Lure.description: The Refined Wood Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone size increase widens the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like allLures, the Refined Wood Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Rope.name: Rope
Rope.description: Intermediate crafting item used as a component of many recipes.

Small Iron Crate.name: Small Iron Crate
Small Iron Crate.description: A Small Iron Crate, use it to safely store valuable resources. Unlike theSmall Wood Crate, it does not require shelter and can be placed outside (immune to storm damage).

Steel Bloom.name: Steel Bloom
Steel Bloom.description: Steel Bloom is a crafted resource that can be smelted in aStone Furnace,Concrete FurnaceorElectric Furnaceto make aSteel Ingot. It can made made fromIron OreorIron IngotandCoal OreorCharcoal.

Steel Bolt.name: Steel Bolt
Steel Bolt.description: The Steel Bolt is ammunition used with aCrossbow. Like arrows and javelins, they may be recovered after being fired into the ground or an animal carcass. Crafted in batches of 5.

Steel Heater Shield.name: Steel Heater Shield
Steel Heater Shield.description: Background information on the Steel Heater Shield can be foundhere.

Steel Ingot.name: Steel Ingot
Steel Ingot.description: Steel Ingot is the refined resource crafted fromSteel Bloom, prospectors may use aStone Furnace,Concrete Furnace, orElectric Furnace.

Steel Javelin.name: Steel Javelin
Steel Javelin.description: The Steel Javelin is a variant of theSteel Spearthat can only be thrown. A cheap upgrade to theIron Javelinthat increases projectile damage with a lower break chance, but is locked until prospectors reach level 20.

Steel Rebar.name: Steel Rebar
Steel Rebar.description: Steel Rebar is a critical component ofConcrete Structures, and is solely used for this purpose.

Steel Screw.name: Steel Screw
Steel Screw.description: Steel Screw is used in crafting high end tools, weapons, and structures likeAluminium Buildings.

Titanium Ingot.name: Titanium Ingot
Titanium Ingot.description: Titanium Ingot is the refined resource crafted fromTitanium Ore, is used widely inTier 4crafting recipes.

Aluminium Ore.name: Aluminium Ore
Aluminium Ore.description: Aluminium Ore is a mid-gameMineralResource. Prospectors can first utilize aluminium once they reach level 20 and unlockTier 3, when it can be crafted into upgradedWeaponslike theRecurve BowandAluminium Arrow. It is widely used in constructs (for example,Aluminium BeamandAluminium Door), and in the late-game it is a vital component ofItemslikeComposite Chest Armor.

Arctic Explorer Saddle.name: Arctic Explorer Saddle
Arctic Explorer Saddle.description: The Arctic Explorer Saddle is a saddle forMountsthat has an artic theme. It is available as part of theCreature Comforts DLCand is a cosmetic change to theBasic Riding Saddlethat provides no additional attributes.

Art Deco Candlestick.name: Art Deco Candlestick
Art Deco Candlestick.description: The Art Deco Candlestick is an gilded item of significant worth. It can be built with either beeswax or animal fat and takes either as fuel inputs.

Bearhide Saddle.name: Bearhide Saddle
Bearhide Saddle.description: The Bearhide Saddle is a saddle forMountsthat has a bear theme. It is available as part of theCreature Comforts DLCand is a cosmetic change to theBasic Riding Saddlethat provides no additional attributes.

Beeswax Wood Halfpieces.name: Beeswax Wood Halfpieces
Beeswax Wood Halfpieces.description: Reinforced wood building pieces can be unlocked inTier 2of theTech Tree. These building pieces are more resistant to damage than their earlierWoodversions with the inclusion ofBeeswax

Beeswax Wood Halfpitches.name: Beeswax Wood Halfpitches
Beeswax Wood Halfpitches.description: Reinforced wood building pieces can be unlocked inTier 2of theTech Tree. These building pieces are more resistant to damage than their earlierWoodversions with the inclusion ofBeeswax

Biomore Backpack.name: Biomore Backpack
Biomore Backpack.description: The Biomore Backpack provides six inventory slots, along with 3 active auras where the prospector and nearby allies having increased physical resistance, quicker healing from bacterial, parasitic and poison modifiers, and additional health regeneration. It also has offers buffs for the wearer, reducing the stamina impact from using tools, and providing more health to downed prospectors when revived. An excellent choice for prospectors specializing in rescues.

Bone.name: Bone
Bone.description: Bone is aAnimal Resourceobtained fromFauna. It is also sometimes found when harvesting fish.

Bone Javelin.name: Bone Javelin
Bone Javelin.description: The Bone Javelin is a variant of theBone Spearthat can only be thrown and is an upgrade to theWood Javelin. Despite it requiring more materials to craft, the increase in damage can mean the difference between winning and losing a fight against Icarus' fauna.

Bone Lure.name: Bone Lure
Bone Lure.description: The Bone Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone increase is the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like allLures, the Bone Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Bone Shield.name: Bone Shield
Bone Shield.description: The Bone Shield is crafted at the Character Crafting menu with the following resources:

Bone Sickle.name: Bone Sickle
Bone Sickle.description: Used by 'attacking' plants such as shrubs,Reed Flower,Wheat, etc. Sickles significantly increase the yield of plants when harvesting.

Brutalist Candlestick.name: Brutalist Candlestick
Brutalist Candlestick.description: The Brutalist Candlestick is mode from concrete and either animal fat or beeswax. There are two varieties by selecting R. Fuel is either beeswax or animal fat.

Carbon Fiber.name: Carbon Fiber
Carbon Fiber.description: While being aTier 3component, Carbon Fiber is only used to makeCarbon Arrows, theCarbon Spear/Javelin, and theCarbon Fibre Round Shieldin the Tier 3 Tech Tree; however, it is a critical component widely used inTier 4crafting.

Carved Wood 2-Seater Couch.name: Carved Wood 2-Seater Couch
Carved Wood 2-Seater Couch.description: The Carved Wood 2-Seater Couch is a decorative item.

Carved Wood 3-Seater Couch.name: Carved Wood 3-Seater Couch
Carved Wood 3-Seater Couch.description: The Carved Wood 3-Seater Couch is a decorative item.

Carved Wood Bookshelf.name: Carved Wood Bookshelf
Carved Wood Bookshelf.description: The Carved Wood Bookshelf is a decorative item.

Carved Wood Cabinet.name: Carved Wood Cabinet
Carved Wood Cabinet.description: The Carved Wood Cabinet is a decorative piece with 10 item slots.

Carved Wood Candlestick.name: Carved Wood Candlestick
Carved Wood Candlestick.description: The Carved Wood Candlestick can be crafted using either beeswax or animal fat and will take either as fuel. There are three varieties that can be selected using the 'R' key while deploying.

Carved Wood Desk Lamp.name: Carved Wood Desk Lamp
Carved Wood Desk Lamp.description: The Carved Wood Desk Lamp is a decorative item that requires 150 kwh of electricity

Carved Wood Dresser.name: Carved Wood Dresser
Carved Wood Dresser.description: The Carved Wood Dresser is a decorative item with 10 inventory slots.

Carved Wood Nightstand.name: Carved Wood Nightstand
Carved Wood Nightstand.description: The Carved Wood Nightstand is a decorative nightstand with 10 inventory slots. It has five build variants available by using the 'R' key when deploying.

Carved Wood Stool.name: Carved Wood Stool
Carved Wood Stool.description: The Carved Wood Stool is a decorative item.

Carved Wood Wardrobe.name: Carved Wood Wardrobe
Carved Wood Wardrobe.description: The Carved Wood Wardrobe is a decorative wardrobe with 10 inventory slots. It has two build variants available by selecting 'R' when deploying.

Coal Ore.name: Coal Ore
Coal Ore.description: Coal Ore is aMineralfound on Icarus in the open and caves. It's most basic use is as a fuel in aCampfireorStone Furnace, though this is somewhat inefficient as it is more valuable as component for crafting.

Coffee Smoked Fatty T-bone.name: Coffee Smoked Fatty T-bone
Coffee Smoked Fatty T-bone.description: Coffee Smoked Fatty T-bone is aFoodwith a uniqueStatus Effect, which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfyHunger.

Copper Ore.name: Copper Ore
Copper Ore.description: Copper Ore is an early-gameMineralResource. It is widely used in the construction ofInterior Wood Building Pieces, and prospectors can make extensive use of copper once they reach level 20 and unlockTier 3, as it is a crucial component inElectronics. In the late game, copper is used in various deployables like theRefrigeratorand theMaterial Processor.

Dried Fatty T-Bone.name: Dried Fatty T-Bone
Dried Fatty T-Bone.description: Dried Fatty T-Bone is aFoodwith a uniqueStatus Effect, which can be stacked with other food buffs. Can be eaten to satisfyHunger.

Fiber.name: Fiber
Fiber.description: In-game description:A bundle of soft fiber, highly useful.

Fiber Farming Packet.name: Fiber Farming Packet
Fiber Farming Packet.description: The Fiber Farming Packet is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospectors loadout before starting a new prospect. Only after landing on Icarus can the packet be consumed, giving the Prospector five Fiber seeds, which then can be planted inDirt Moundsor Crop plots to growPlant Resources.

Fiber Lure.name: Fiber Lure
Fiber Lure.description: The Fiber Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone increase is the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like allLures, the Fiber Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Frozen Ore.name: Frozen Ore
Frozen Ore.description: Frozen Ore is a resource produced as a by-product of mining a mineral node with aPickaxethat has a chance to produce frozen ore, such as theCold Steel PickaxeorInaris "Viridian" Pickaxe.

Gold Ore.name: Gold Ore
Gold Ore.description: Gold Ore is aMineralResource. Prospectors can make extensive use of Gold Ore once they reach level 20 and unlockTier 3, as it is a crucial component inElectronics.

Gold Ore Lure.name: Gold Ore Lure
Gold Ore Lure.description: The Gold Ore Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. The capture zone size increase widens the size of the capture area during the fishing minigame, increasing the success chance of catching a fish. Like allLures, the Gold Ore Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Ice Borer.name: Ice Borer
Ice Borer.description: The Ice Borer will drill super-cooled ice deposits when supplied with biofuel from aBiofuel Can/MXC Fuel Canister. Super-cooled ice deposits can only be found on frozen lakes and rivers in the Arctic regions of Prometheus (Biomes: Glacial Cascade or Alpine Steppe - a map of Prometheus biomes can be foundhere.). The Ice Borer has 5 slots and will last 2 hours and 5 minutes on a fullBiofuel Can.

Industrial Candlestick.name: Industrial Candlestick
Industrial Candlestick.description: The Industrial Candlestick is a decorative item from the Industrial Furniture Pack DLC.

Interior Wood Cupboard.name: Interior Wood Cupboard
Interior Wood Cupboard.description: A Interior Wood Cupboard made of refined wood and copper nails. Similar size to theWood Cupboard.

Interior Wood Halfpieces.name: Interior Wood Halfpieces
Interior Wood Halfpieces.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with aRepair Hammer.

Interior Wood Halfpitches.name: Interior Wood Halfpitches
Interior Wood Halfpitches.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with aRepair Hammer.

Interior Wood Ladder.name: Interior Wood Ladder
Interior Wood Ladder.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with aRepair Hammer.

Interior Wood Railing.name: Interior Wood Railing
Interior Wood Railing.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with aRepair Hammer.

Interior Wood Railing Gate.name: Interior Wood Railing Gate
Interior Wood Railing Gate.description: Interior Wood Building Pieces bring a clean appealing aesthetic to any base, although usually rather weak to weather, and quite flammable. Can be repaired with aRepair Hammer.

Iron Ore.name: Iron Ore
Iron Ore.description: Iron Ore is aMineral, that allows prospectors to createTier 2/Tier 3ToolsandWeaponswith both theAnvil BenchandMachining Bench. In addition, iron is widely used inSteel Ingotfor craftingItemssuch as theSteel Pickaxe, and Late-game Deployables like theFabricator/Electric Furnace.

Medium Interior Wood Crate.name: Medium Interior Wood Crate
Medium Interior Wood Crate.description: A Medium Interior Wood Crate made of refined wood and copper nails. Similar size to theMedium Wood Crate.

Medium Wood Crate.name: Medium Wood Crate
Medium Wood Crate.description: Larger than theSmall Wood Crate, the Medium Wood Crate also possesses an increased inventory space with 20 slots. Like most otherDeployables, this must be underShelteror it will be destroyed when exposed toWeatherevents. It is possible to loot the contents if this crate is destroyed, but only for a limited time.

Medium Wood Hedgehog.name: Medium Wood Hedgehog
Medium Wood Hedgehog.description: The Medium Wood Hedgehog are sturdy defenses used around your base or while at objectives for protection of equipment.

NOREX Boss Tracker Upgrade.name: NOREX Boss Tracker Upgrade
NOREX Boss Tracker Upgrade.description: The NOREX Boss Tracker Upgrade is an upgrade for theCONT4CT Devicedeployed in anOpen Worldmap that visually upgrades the screens and provides a Bosses tab that provides information on the currently active world bosses.

Platinum Ore.name: Platinum Ore
Platinum Ore.description: Platinum Ore is a mid-gameMineralResource, and can be utilized by prospectors after they reach level 20 and unlockTier 3in theTech Tree. Platinum is required for a number of upgradedToolsandWeapons, including thePlatinum SpearandPlatinum Sickle.

Silica Ore.name: Silica Ore
Silica Ore.description: Silica Ore is aMineralfound on the surface of Icarus. Prospectors are likely to first use silica to create theMortar and Pestle. However, it is also the key in making glass and concrete.

Small Interior Wood Crate.name: Small Interior Wood Crate
Small Interior Wood Crate.description: A Small Interior Wood Crate made of refined wood and copper nails. Similar size to theSmall Wood Crate.

Small Stone Sign.name: Small Stone Sign
Small Stone Sign.description: The Small Stone Sign is a deployable sign post available as a wall sign, floor sign or a small angled variant.

Small Wood Crate.name: Small Wood Crate
Small Wood Crate.description: The Small Wood Crate is the first available storage container that can be made by the prospector. While limited in inventory space, anything here will not be lost upon the death of the prospector or count against inventory weight. Like most otherDeployables, this must be underShelteror it will be destroyed when exposed toWeatherevents. It is possible to loot the contents if this crate is destroyed, but only for a limited time.

Small Wood Sign.name: Small Wood Sign
Small Wood Sign.description: A Small Wood Sign made ofRefined WoodandCopper Nails.

Stick.name: Stick
Stick.description: Sticks are harvested by picking them up off of the ground, or when harvesting small trees and saplings. Sticks can also be crafted from wood at theCarpentry Bench, or in theCharacter Craftingmenu if you have theWood Breakdowntalent (and its matching Blueprint in Tier 1).

Stone.name: Stone
Stone.description: Stone is one of the most abundantMineralsavailable on Icarus. Prospectors will make extensive use of stone from the moment they exit their drop-pods, as it is widely used in the early game for bothToolsandWeapons.

Stonejaw Trophy.name: Stonejaw Trophy
Stonejaw Trophy.description: Stonejaw Trophies are decorative deployables that can be placed on any wall surface and are used to liven any living space. Aside from helping prospectors complete theBestiary, it can also be used in tandem with otherFurnitureto increase theCozinessof your living quarters, increasing the duration and effectiveness of theWell Rested Buff.

Stone Brick.name: Stone Brick
Stone Brick.description: Stone Bricks are a refined resource primarily used to craftStone Brick Building Piecesat anAdvanced Masonry Bench/Electric Masonry Bench.

Stone Brick Halfpieces.name: Stone Brick Halfpieces
Stone Brick Halfpieces.description: Stone Brick pieces offer +10 Insulation from Temperature, +100% Falling Tree Resistance and +65% Wind Resistance.

Stone Brick Halfpitches.name: Stone Brick Halfpitches
Stone Brick Halfpitches.description: Stone Brick pieces offer +10 Insulation from Temperature, +100% Falling Tree Resistance and +65% Wind Resistance.

Stone Buffalo Statue.name: Stone Buffalo Statue
Stone Buffalo Statue.description: The Stone Buffalo Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Cairn.name: Stone Cairn
Stone Cairn.description: Stone Cairns are a deployable item can be used as waystones to mark a path across the landscape or to mark areas of significance. Stone Cairns also have one inventory slot that can be used to store deceased pets, marking their grave and providing them a small memorial. When inspecting the Stone Cairn by pressing F, the name and description can be changed as needed.

Stone Caveworm Statue.name: Stone Caveworm Statue
Stone Caveworm Statue.description: The Stone Caveworm Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Deer Statue.name: Stone Deer Statue
Stone Deer Statue.description: The Stone Deer Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Elephant Statue.name: Stone Elephant Statue
Stone Elephant Statue.description: The Stone Elephant Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Frame.name: Stone Frame
Stone Frame.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.

Stone Halfpieces.name: Stone Halfpieces
Stone Halfpieces.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.

Stone Halfpitches.name: Stone Halfpitches
Stone Halfpitches.description: Stronger than Wood, and resistant to weather, Stone Buildings are a game changer when it comes to surviving on Icarus.

Stone Komodo Statue.name: Stone Komodo Statue
Stone Komodo Statue.description: The Stone Komodo Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Pile.name: Stone Pile
Stone Pile.description: The Stone Pile, alongside theWood Pile, are makeshift storage options for large quantities of each raw material. The Stone Pile is immune to ALLWeatherdamage and can be used as a durable barrier toFauna, especially against Fauna like theGrizzly Bear. If placed with just a narrow opening between piles, Bears have an incredibly difficult time getting through which allows the Prospector to melee attack just beyond the bear's attack range.

Stone Piranha Statue.name: Stone Piranha Statue
Stone Piranha Statue.description: The Stone Piranha Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Rabbit Statue.name: Stone Rabbit Statue
Stone Rabbit Statue.description: The Stone Rabbit Statue is a decorative stone item.

Stone Water Trough.name: Stone Water Trough
Stone Water Trough.description: The Stone Water Trough is a decorative upgrade to theWater Troughthat allows multiple creatures to drink from it simultaneously and can be connected toWaterusing aWater Pipe Tool, similar to theLarge Water Trough. The Stone Water Trough can only store water and cannot provide water to the rest of the network likeWater BarrelsorMetal Rain Reservoirs.

Titanium Ore.name: Titanium Ore
Titanium Ore.description: Titanium Ore is a late-game Mineral, and can be utilized by prospectors after they reach level 30 and unlock theFabricatorin theTier 4Tech Tree. Titanium  represents the current pinnacle of material strength forToolsand for severalWeapons.

Water Borer.name: Water Borer
Water Borer.description: The Water Borer is a device that can be placed onEnzyme Geysersand when powered, can be used to extractWaterwhich can be fed into a water network.

Wood.name: Wood
Wood.description: Wood is a basic crafting ingredient obtained from Trees using an axe or harvested by hand in theDesertvia Cacti. Wood can also be used as a Fuel source forCampfire,Fireplace, andStone Furnace.

Wooden Lure.name: Wooden Lure
Wooden Lure.description: The Wooden Lure can be attached to aFishing Rodor aBasic Fishing Trap/Advanced Fishing Trapto provide an increase to different attributes detailed in the infobox. Like allLures, the Wooden Lure degrades with use and will eventually break after ten uses.

Wooden Shovel.name: Wooden Shovel
Wooden Shovel.description: The Wooden Shovel is an early-gameToolused to createDirt Mounds(right-click), harvestIce/Dirt/Sand(left-click), or remove ash/snow buildup on structures in theArctic/Volcanicbiomes on Icarus.

Wood Buffalo Statue.name: Wood Buffalo Statue
Wood Buffalo Statue.description: The Wood Buffalo Statue is a decorative wood item.

Wood Burner.name: Wood Burner
Wood Burner.description: The Wood Burner is a source of heat and basic cooking similar to aCampfireorFireplace. It provides the Warming Fire effect (heat and +100% Perceived Threat) allowing a Prospector to sleep nearby. Once fuel is added, it can be activated and will consume fuel regardless of any selected recipe.

Wood Composter.name: Wood Composter
Wood Composter.description: Wood Composter increases the rate at which food spoils, and will turnSpoiled PlantsorGuanointoBasic Fertilizer.

Wood Crop Plot.name: Wood Crop Plot
Wood Crop Plot.description: The Wood Crop Plot is a farming plot for growingSeedsthat can later be harvested forPlant Resourcesonce fully grown. Unless the Prospector has theFresh Is Besttalent when deploying a seed into the crop plot, the grownPlant Resourcewill eventually wither if not harvested.

Wood Cupboard.name: Wood Cupboard
Wood Cupboard.description: Taking up the same floor-space but with a much larger inventory, this is a great upgrade from theMedium Wood Crate.

Wood Deer Statue.name: Wood Deer Statue
Wood Deer Statue.description: The Wood Deer Statue is a decorative wood item.

Wood Gate Fortification.name: Wood Gate Fortification
Wood Gate Fortification.description: The Wood Gate Fortification serves as an entrance when usingWood Wall Fortifications. Similar toMedium Wood Hedgehogs, the Wood Gate Fortification does not take damage during storms.Wood Spikes Fortificationcannot be mounted to the Wood Gate Fortification.

Wood Halfpieces.name: Wood Halfpieces
Wood Halfpieces.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection toDeployablesandStoragecontainers. Wood roofs or walls require a floor or wall structure such asWood Wallfor snapping. Hold 'R' while placing the Wood Halfpieces itself to determine shape as well as placement as roof, or wall.

Wood Halfpitches.name: Wood Halfpitches
Wood Halfpitches.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection toDeployablesandStoragecontainers. Wood roofs or walls require a floor or wall structure such asWood Wallfor snapping. Hold 'R' while placing the Wood Halfpitches itself to determine shape as well as placement as roof, or wall.

Wood Javelin.name: Wood Javelin
Wood Javelin.description: The Wood Javelin is a variant of theWood Spearthat can only be thrown. The Wood Javelin has the slowest projectile travel time and highest projectile fall-off, but that can be overlooked by it's cheap producibility.

Wood Ladder.name: Wood Ladder
Wood Ladder.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offer good protection toDeployablesandStoragecontainers. Wood Ladders can be use with Trapdoor holes (hold R while holding a floor building piece and select the Trapdoor variant from the radial wheel). Does not snap to trapdoor holes.

Wood Pile.name: Wood Pile
Wood Pile.description: The Wood Pile, alongside theStone Pile, are makeshift storage options for large quantities of each raw material. Though immune to mostWeatherdamage, beware of lightning strikes. Can be used as a durable barrier toFauna, especially against Fauna like theGrizzly Bear, although the stone variant is preferred.

Wood Piranha Statue.name: Wood Piranha Statue
Wood Piranha Statue.description: The Wood Piranha Statue is a decorative wood item.

Wood Rabbit Statue.name: Wood Rabbit Statue
Wood Rabbit Statue.description: The Wood Rabbit Statue is a decorative wood item.

Wood Railing.name: Wood Railing
Wood Railing.description: The Wood Railing is part of theWood Building Trim Set, which is learned in theTier 1Tech Tree after unlocking theWood Building Base Set.

Wood Railing Gate.name: Wood Railing Gate
Wood Railing Gate.description: Stronger than Thatch, wood buildings are a good starting point for Prospectors wanting to establish a 'Main Base'. While still flammable, they are able to fully withstand most light storms and offers good protection toDeployablesandStoragecontainers. Wood Railing Gates can be deployed on their own or can be snapped to railings/floors.

Wood Shield.name: Wood Shield
Wood Shield.description: The Wood Shield is crafted at the Anvil, Forge, or Foundry with the following resources:

Wood Spikes Fortification.name: Wood Spikes Fortification
Wood Spikes Fortification.description: The Wood Spikes Fortification serves as large hedgehog that can attachWood Wall Fortificationsto fend off the predators of Icarus. Similar toMedium Wood Hedgehogs, the Wood Spikes Fortification does not take damage during storms.

Wood Walkway Fortification.name: Wood Walkway Fortification
Wood Walkway Fortification.description: The Wood Walkway Fortification is attached toWood Wall Fortificationsand serves as a platform that Prospectors can stand on, providing them a vantage point to see over their walls. Similar toMedium Wood Hedgehogs, the Wood Walkway Fortification does not take damage during storms.

Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner.name: Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner
Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner.description: LocatesDeep Ore Depositswithin the area that can be mined with aBiofuel Deep-Mining Drillor anElectric Deep-Mining Drill. Unlike theDeep Mining Ore Scanner, the Advanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner can be toggled to detect specific deep ore deposits.

Battery Powered Lantern.name: Battery Powered Lantern
Battery Powered Lantern.description: The Battery Powered Lantern is a portableHandheld Light Sourcethat provides illumination in the surrounding area. Can be equipped in the "L" light slot on the hotbar.

Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill.name: Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill
Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill.description: The Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill will minedeep mining ore depositswhen supplied with biofuel from aBiofuel Can/MXC Fuel Canister. The Biofuel Deep-Mining Drill has 5 slots and will last 2 hours and 5 minutes on a fullBiofuel Can.

Biofuel Radar.name: Biofuel Radar
Biofuel Radar.description: The Biofuel Radar is used to scan forExotic/Volatile Raw Exoticdeposits. Once activated, aggravatedFauna(varies per region) will attempt to destroy the radar by any means necessary. Radars of all types will show ALL exotic veins on the map in each scan, regardless of whether they have been depleted. Scans performed in anOutpostwill not complete as there are no exotic veins in them. This can be used to spawn aggressive wildlife for resources or experience.

Cave Scanner.name: Cave Scanner
Cave Scanner.description: Locates caves with audible beeping. While the cave scanner is equipped and in hand the scanner's lights will blink and it will beep so long as a cave is somewhat nearby. The frequency of blinking/beeping increases as the Prospector approaches a cave. Furthermore, the scanner will beep more rapidly if the Prospector is looking in the direction of a cave.

Deep Mining Ore Scanner.name: Deep Mining Ore Scanner
Deep Mining Ore Scanner.description: LocatesDeep Ore Depositswithin the area that can be mined with aBiofuel Deep-Mining Drillor anElectric Deep-Mining Drill. Does not indicate the type of deep ore deposit detected, unlike theAdvanced Deep Mining Ore Scanner.

Electric Deep-Mining Drill.name: Electric Deep-Mining Drill
Electric Deep-Mining Drill.description: The Electric Deep-Mining Drill will mineDeep Mining Ore Depositswhen supplied with 2,000 units ofPower. The Electric Deep-Mining Drill has more inventory slots, twenty in all, 15 more slots than its biofuel counterpart. This allows 1000 or 2000 ore to be accumulated before needing to be emptied, depending on the ore type.

Electric Radar.name: Electric Radar
Electric Radar.description: The Electric Radar is used to scan forExotic/Volatile Raw Exoticdeposits. Once activated, aggravatedFauna(varies per region) will attempt to destroy the radar by any means necessary. Radars of all types will show ALL exotic veins on the map in each scan, regardless of whether they have been depleted. Scans performed in anOutpostwill not complete as there are no exotic veins in them. This can be used to spawn aggressive wildlife for resources or experience.

IC-001 Radar.name: IC-001 Radar
IC-001 Radar.description: The IC-001 Radar is used to scan forExotic/Volatile Raw Exoticdeposits. Once activated, aggravatedFauna(varies per region) will attempt to destroy the radar by any means necessary. Radars of all types will show ALL exotic veins on the map in each scan, regardless of whether they have been depleted. Scans performed in anOutpostwill not complete as there are no exotic veins in them. This can be used to spawn aggressive wildlife for resources or experience.

Lantern.name: Lantern
Lantern.description: Similar to torches, the durability of the Lantern will decrease over time. The Lantern can be repaired (refilled) at aCrafting Benchwith 1Animal Fat. The Lantern will last about 45 minutes when lit before needing repairs. The Lantern allows prospectors to see approximately 10 meters, or 5 standard floor pieces, from their position.

Wood Rag Torch.name: Wood Rag Torch
Wood Rag Torch.description: The first available source ofLight Source. Can be equipped in the "L" light slot on the hotbar. When lit, the Wood Rag Torch also provides heat in addition to light. The Wood Rag Torch will last about 33 minutes and 20 seconds when lit before extinguishing. The Wood Rag Torch allows prospectors to see approximately 6 meters, or 3 standard floor pieces, from their position.

Wood Torch.name: Wood Torch
Wood Torch.description:
The Wood Torch is an upgraded handheldLight Sourcethat will last longer than theWood Rag Torch. Can be equipped in the "L" light slot on the hotbar and provides heat when lit.
The Wood Torch will last about 50 minutes when lit before extinguishing. The Wood Torch allows prospectors to see approximately 6 meters, or 3 standard floor pieces, from their position.

Black Wolf Knife.name: Black Wolf Knife
Black Wolf Knife.description: The Black Wolf Knife is a knife with a 25% chance to inflict hemorrhage on targets and can be used as a tool to skin fauna. For the thrown variant of the Black Wolf Knife, viewBlack Wolf Throwing Knife.

Black Wolf Throwing Knife.name: Black Wolf Throwing Knife
Black Wolf Throwing Knife.description: The Black Wolf Throwing Knife is a variant of theBlack Wolf Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theBlack Wolf Knife, the Black Wolf Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Bone Knife.name: Bone Knife
Bone Knife.description: The Bone Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from theStone Knife, the Bone Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool.

Bone Spear.name: Bone Spear
Bone Spear.description: Spears increase the range to which Prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high. The Bone Spear has twice as much health than theWood Spear, which can be the difference between winning and losing against Icarus' fauna. Unlike theBone Javelin, the Bone Spear cannot be thrown.

Bone Throwing Knife.name: Bone Throwing Knife
Bone Throwing Knife.description: The Bone Throwing Knife is a variant of theBone Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theBone Knife, the Bone Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Carbon Spear.name: Carbon Spear
Carbon Spear.description: The Carbon Spear is an upgrade to thePlatinum Spearthat deals more damage and is cheaper to craft. Unlike theCarbon Javelin, the Carbon Spear cannot be thrown.

Caveworm Knife.name: Caveworm Knife
Caveworm Knife.description: The Caveworm Knife is made with resources obtained fromCaveworms. Though the Caveworm Knife can be used as a melee weapon or tool to skin fauna, the Caveworm Knife has very little durability, which can prove problematic while on the go as it can only be repaired at anAnvil Bench.

Caveworm Spear.name: Caveworm Spear
Caveworm Spear.description: Spears increase the range to which Prospectors can attack fauna, providing a unique advantage when up high. Unlike theCaveworm Javelin, the Caveworm Spear cannot be thrown.

Caveworm Throwing Knife.name: Caveworm Throwing Knife
Caveworm Throwing Knife.description: The Caveworm Throwing Knife is a variant of theCaveworm Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theCaveworm Knife, the Caveworm Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Cold Steel Axe.name: Cold Steel Axe
Cold Steel Axe.description: The Cold Steel Axe is a mid/late-gameAxethat is introduced withChapter - New Frontier. The Cold Steel Axe can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

Cold Steel Knife.name: Cold Steel Knife
Cold Steel Knife.description: The Cold Steel Knife is a mid/late-gameKnifethat is introduced with the addition ofCold Steel Ingotson thePrometheusmap.

Cold Steel Pickaxe.name: Cold Steel Pickaxe
Cold Steel Pickaxe.description: The Cold Steel Pickaxe is a mid/late-gamePickaxethat was introduced withNew Frontiers.

Cold Steel Sledgehammer.name: Cold Steel Sledgehammer
Cold Steel Sledgehammer.description: Cold Steel Sledgehammer is aTier 3Sledgehammermade withCold Steel Ingots. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Cold Steel Spear.name: Cold Steel Spear
Cold Steel Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike theCold Steel Javelin, the Cold Steel Spear cannot be thrown.

Cold Steel Throwing Knife.name: Cold Steel Throwing Knife
Cold Steel Throwing Knife.description: The Cold Steel Throwing Knife is a variant of theCold Steel Knifethat can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching theCold Steel Knife. Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Combat Knife.name: Combat Knife
Combat Knife.description: While not particularly good for skinning a carcass, this knife excels in close quarters combat. Cannot be thrown.

Composite Spear.name: Composite Spear
Composite Spear.description: The Composite Spear is an upgrade to theTitanium Spearthat deals more damage and is cheaper to craft once Composites can be crafted. DespiteCompositesbeing a hefty tech investment, the Composite Spear has the highest damage output and durability outside ofPrometheusexclusive Spears. Unlike theComposite Javelin, the Composite Spear cannot be thrown.

Frag Grenade.name: Frag Grenade
Frag Grenade.description: An explosive weapon thrown by hand. Hold left click to charge a throw. The grenade timer starts when the grenade leaves your hand and will take a few seconds to detonate. Stacks up to 5.

Inaris \"Agua\" Spear.name: Inaris "Agua" Spear
Inaris \"Agua\" Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Agua" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no WorkshopJavelins.

Inaris \"Cerulean\" Knife.name: Inaris "Cerulean" Knife
Inaris \"Cerulean\" Knife.description: The Inaris "Cerulean" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing frost damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Inaris "Cerulean" Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshopThrowing Knives.

Inaris \"Claret\" Pickaxe.name: Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe
Inaris \"Claret\" Pickaxe.description: The Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing fire damage to targets. Since the Inaris "Claret" Pickaxe has the same mining radius and yield as theLarkwell Martinez Pickaxe, Prospectors are better off using theInaris "Neves" Pickaxefor mining.

Inaris \"Cobalt\" Spear.name: Inaris "Cobalt" Spear
Inaris \"Cobalt\" Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Cobalt" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no WorkshopJavelins.

Inaris \"Crimson\" Knife.name: Inaris "Crimson" Knife
Inaris \"Crimson\" Knife.description: The Inaris "Crimson" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing fire damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. Despite what the flavor text says, the Inaris "Crimson" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no workshopThrowing Knives.

Inaris \"Dawn\" Axe.name: Inaris "Dawn" Axe
Inaris \"Dawn\" Axe.description: The Inaris "Dawn" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing Fire damage to targets. Ideally used with theBerserkertalent, which increases axe melee damage.

Inaris \"Dias\" Axe.name: Inaris "Dias" Axe
Inaris \"Dias\" Axe.description: The Inaris "Dias" Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anSteel Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees. Unlike otherAxes, the Inaris "Dias" Axe is the only Axe that lowers the carry weight of wood by 50% when equipped, making it a valuable tool when transporting wood when paired with theGatherer's Backpack.

Inaris \"Dusk\" Spear.name: Inaris "Dusk" Spear
Inaris \"Dusk\" Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Inaris "Dusk" Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no WorkshopJavelins.

Inaris \"Ersa\" Axe.name: Inaris "Ersa" Axe
Inaris \"Ersa\" Axe.description: The Inaris "Ersa" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing Frost damage to targets. Ideally used with theBerserkertalent, which increases axe melee damage.

Inaris \"Gris\" Spear.name: Inaris "Gris" Spear
Inaris \"Gris\" Spear.description: The Inaris "Gris" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Inaris \"Neves\" Pickaxe.name: Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe
Inaris \"Neves\" Pickaxe.description:
The Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aTitanium Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while greatly increasing yield.
Unlike other pickaxes, the Inaris "Neves" Pickaxe is the only pickaxe that reduces the over-encumbrance penalty by 50% when equipped, which makes mobility while over-encumbered bearable when paired with the talentCarry OnandMass Dampener Modules.

Inaris \"Night\" Pickaxe.name: Inaris "Night" Pickaxe
Inaris \"Night\" Pickaxe.description: The Inaris "Night" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat and harvestingNoxious Crust. It deals poison damage to targets, a large amount of damage to armor, has a penalty for mining yield, but also produces Noxious Crust that can be cleaned to produce additionalMinerals.

Inaris \"Sali\" Axe.name: Inaris "Sali" Axe
Inaris \"Sali\" Axe.description: The Inaris "Sali" Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing poison damage to targets and generatingInfected Barkwhen harvesting trees.

Inaris \"Shade\" Knife.name: Inaris "Shade" Knife
Inaris \"Shade\" Knife.description: The Inaris "Shade" Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing poison damage to targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Inaris "Shade" Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshopThrowing Knives.

Inaris \"Ventura\" Knife.name: Inaris "Ventura" Knife
Inaris \"Ventura\" Knife.description: Grants immunity to normal wounds while held, making it a useful tool when fighting severalwolvessimultaneously. Does not preventDeep Wounds. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Inaris "Ventura" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Inaris \"Viridian\" Pickaxe.name: Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe
Inaris \"Viridian\" Pickaxe.description: The Inaris "Viridian" Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing frost damage to targets.

Iron Axe.name: Iron Axe
Iron Axe.description: The Iron Axe is the 2nd axe you will unlock during your time on Icarus. It is located at the bottom of theTier 2tech tree, right after theAnvil Bench.

Iron Hammer.name: Iron Hammer
Iron Hammer.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

Iron Knife.name: Iron Knife
Iron Knife.description: The Iron Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from theBone Knife, the Iron Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. It is also the first knife capable of skinning larger fauna such as theGrizzly BearandBuffalo. An attachment slot is available, allowing for the application ofTool Attachment Packsat anAlteration Bench/Advanced Alteration Bench.

Iron Pickaxe.name: Iron Pickaxe
Iron Pickaxe.description: The Iron Pickaxe is the 2nd pickaxe prospectors can unlock during their time on Icarus. The blueprint is located at the bottom of the tier 2 tech tree and is considerably better than the previousStone Pickaxe, granting a 125% boost to mining efficiency. Like all iron tools, the iron pickaxe is repairable at anAnvil Bench.

Iron Spear.name: Iron Spear
Iron Spear.description: The Iron Spear is the firstSpearavailable to prospectors once they reach Tier 2 and serves as an upgrade to its Tier 1 counterparts. Unlike theIron Javelin, the Iron Spear cannot be thrown.

Iron Throwing Knife.name: Iron Throwing Knife
Iron Throwing Knife.description: The Iron Throwing Knife is a variant of theIron Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theIron Knife, the Iron Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Larkwell Martinez Axe.name: Larkwell Martinez Axe
Larkwell Martinez Axe.description: The Larkwell Martinez Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anSteel Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees. Similar to theInaris "Dias" Axe, the Larkwell Martinez Axe also reduces the carry weight of wood when equipped.

Larkwell Martinez Hammer.name: Larkwell Martinez Hammer
Larkwell Martinez Hammer.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

Larkwell Martinez Knife.name: Larkwell Martinez Knife
Larkwell Martinez Knife.description: The Larkwell Martinez Knife is the hardest-hitting Workshop knife available. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Larkwell Martinez Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe.name: Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe
Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe.description: The Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aPlatinum Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield. Similar to theInaris "Neves" Pickaxe, the Larkwell Martinez Pickaxe reduces the over-encumbrance penalty by 10% when equipped.

Larkwell Martinez Spear.name: Larkwell Martinez Spear
Larkwell Martinez Spear.description: The Larkwell Martinez Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Machete.name: Machete
Machete.description: The Machete is aToolthat can be used to skin Fauna and harvest Carrots, Wheat, shrubbery, etc. similar toSickles.

Miasmic Axe.name: Miasmic Axe
Miasmic Axe.description: Miasmic Axe is aTier 4Axemade withDistilled Miasmic Coatingderived fromCrystallized Miasmafound in theSwampsonPrometheus. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Miasmic Knife.name: Miasmic Knife
Miasmic Knife.description: Miasmic Knife is aTier 4Knifemade withDistilled Miasmic Coatingderived fromCrystallized Miasmafound in theSwampsonPrometheus. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Miasmic Pickaxe.name: Miasmic Pickaxe
Miasmic Pickaxe.description: Miasmic Pickaxe is aTier 4Pickaxemade withDistilled Miasmic Coatingderived fromCrystallized Miasmafound in theSwampsonPrometheus. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Miasmic Sledgehammer.name: Miasmic Sledgehammer
Miasmic Sledgehammer.description: Miasmic Sledgehammer is aTier 4Sledgehammermade withDistilled Miasmic Coatingderived fromCrystallized Miasmafound in theSwampsonPrometheus. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Miasmic Spear.name: Miasmic Spear
Miasmic Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike theMiasmic Javelin, the Miasmic Spear cannot be thrown.

Miasmic Throwing Knife.name: Miasmic Throwing Knife
Miasmic Throwing Knife.description: The Miasmic Throwing Knife is a variant of theMiasmic Knifethat can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching theMiasmic Knife. Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

MXC Axe.name: MXC Axe
MXC Axe.description: The MXC Axe is the Workshop equivalent of aStone Axe, providing a minor boost to felling damage and yield.

MXC Hammer.name: MXC Hammer
MXC Hammer.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

MXC Knife.name: MXC Knife
MXC Knife.description: The MXC Knife is equivalent toTier 2Tech like theIron Knife, giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such asBuffaloandGrizzly Bears. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the MXC Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

MXC Pickaxe.name: MXC Pickaxe
MXC Pickaxe.description: The MXC Pickaxe is the workshop equivalent of aStone Pickaxe, providing a minor boost to mining yield and efficiency.

MXC Spear.name: MXC Spear
MXC Spear.description: The MXC Spear is the firstSpearthat can be unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Obsidian Sledgehammer.name: Obsidian Sledgehammer
Obsidian Sledgehammer.description: Obsidian Sledgehammer is aTier 2Sledgehammermade withShaped Obsidian. Due to the materials required, crafting the item requires the New Frontiers DLC.

Obsidian Spear.name: Obsidian Spear
Obsidian Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. Unlike theObsidian Javelin, the Obsidian Spear cannot be thrown.

Obsidian Throwing Knife.name: Obsidian Throwing Knife
Obsidian Throwing Knife.description: The Obsidian Throwing Knife is a variant of theObsidian Knifethat can only be thrown and is unlocked upon researching theObsidian Knife. Cannot be used to skin Fauna - crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Platinum Axe.name: Platinum Axe
Platinum Axe.description: The Platinum Axe is a mid/late-gameAxethat can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

Platinum Hammer.name: Platinum Hammer
Platinum Hammer.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

Platinum Knife.name: Platinum Knife
Platinum Knife.description: The Platinum Knife is an upgrade in damage and durability from theSteel Knife, the Platinum Knife can be used as either a melee weapon or tool. Unlike thePlatinum Throwing Knife, the Platinum Knife cannot be thrown.

Platinum Pickaxe.name: Platinum Pickaxe
Platinum Pickaxe.description: The Platinum Pickaxe is a mid/late-gamePickaxethat can be crafted while on the surface of Icarus.

Platinum Spear.name: Platinum Spear
Platinum Spear.description: The Platinum Spear is the firstSpearavailable to prospectors once they reach Tier 3 and serves as an, albeit expensive, upgrade to its Tier 2 counterparts. Unlike thePlatinum Javelin, the Platinum Spear cannot be thrown.

Platinum Throwing Knife.name: Platinum Throwing Knife
Platinum Throwing Knife.description: The Platinum Throwing Knife is a variant of thePlatinum Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike thePlatinum Knife, the Platinum Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Sandworm Knife.name: Sandworm Knife
Sandworm Knife.description: The Sandworm Knife is made with scales obtained fromSandworms. Considering the Sandworm Knife deals the same amount of damage as aSteel Knife, the Sandworm Knife is overshadowed by higher-tier knives and is not worth the effort.

Sandworm Spear.name: Sandworm Spear
Sandworm Spear.description: The Sandworm Spear is made with scales fromSandwormsand can be used for melee combat with reach. Considering the Sandworm Spear deals the same amount of damage as aBone Spear, the Sandworm Spear is overshadowed by higher-tier spears and currently not worth the effort.

Sandworm Throwing Knife.name: Sandworm Throwing Knife
Sandworm Throwing Knife.description: The Sandworm Throwing Knife is a variant of theSandworm Knifethat can be thrown. Unlike theSandworm Knife, the Sandworm Throwing Knife cannot be used to skin fauna. Crafted in batches of five and stacks up to fifty.

Shengong \"Akira\" Hammer.name: Shengong "Akira" Hammer
Shengong \"Akira\" Hammer.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

Shengong CY7 Axe.name: Shengong CY7 Axe
Shengong CY7 Axe.description: The Shengong CY7 Axe is a Workshop Axe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with the chance to significantly hinder targets. Ideally used with theBerserkertalent, which increases axe melee damage.

Shengong \"Daokou\" Knife.name: Shengong "Daokou" Knife
Shengong \"Daokou\" Knife.description: The Shengong "Daokou" Knife is equivalent toTier 2Tech like theIron Knife, giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such asBuffaloandGrizzly Bears. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Shengong "Daokou" Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Shengong \"Dida\" Spear.name: Shengong "Dida" Spear
Shengong \"Dida\" Spear.description: The Shengong "Dida" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Shengong DL7 Knife.name: Shengong DL7 Knife
Shengong DL7 Knife.description: The Shengong DL7 Knife is a Workshop Knife geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with a chance to significantly hinder targets. Though the elemental damage does not scale with Knife talents, the debuff applied to targets can prove useful in certain situations. The Shengong DL7 Knife cannot be thrown, and there currently are no workshopThrowing Knives.

Shengong \"Dong\" Pickaxe.name: Shengong "Dong" Pickaxe
Shengong \"Dong\" Pickaxe.description: The Shengong "Dong" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aSteel Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

Shengong \"Gong Bu\" Spear.name: Shengong "Gong Bu" Spear
Shengong \"Gong Bu\" Spear.description: The Shengong "Gong Bu" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Shengong \"Heike\" Axe.name: Shengong "Heike" Axe
Shengong \"Heike\" Axe.description: The Shengong "Heike" Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anIron Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

Shengong \"Jiju\" Spear.name: Shengong "Jiju" Spear
Shengong \"Jiju\" Spear.description: The Shengong "Jiju" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Shengong \"Jushi\" Pickaxe.name: Shengong "Jushi" Pickaxe
Shengong \"Jushi\" Pickaxe.description: The Shengong "Jushi" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aSteel Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

Shengong \"Kuang\" Pickaxe.name: Shengong "Kuang" Pickaxe
Shengong \"Kuang\" Pickaxe.description: The Shengong "Kuang" Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aSteel Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

Shengong 'Lie' Axe.name: Shengong 'Lie' Axe
Shengong 'Lie' Axe.description: The Shengong 'Lie' Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anIron Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

Shengong PF1 Spear.name: Shengong PF1 Spear
Shengong PF1 Spear.description: Element damage does not scale with Spear talents. The Shengong PF1 Spear cannot be thrown, and there are currently no WorkshopJavelins.

Shengong 'Qie' Knife.name: Shengong 'Qie' Knife
Shengong 'Qie' Knife.description: This knife and others, such as theShengong 'Sichou' Knife, with the additional attribute that gives increased skinning yield actually has a 230% Yield from Skinning. This is because the additional attribute is multiplicative and not additive, making them better than theTitanium KnifeorInaris "Ventura" Knifeat skinning. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Shengong 'Qie' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Shengong 'Sen' Axe.name: Shengong 'Sen' Axe
Shengong 'Sen' Axe.description: The Shengong 'Sen' Axe is the Workshop equivalent of anIron Axe, allowing Prospectors to fell trees faster while also increasing the amount received from felling trees.

Shengong 'Shui' Knife.name: Shengong 'Shui' Knife
Shengong 'Shui' Knife.description: The Shengong 'Shui' Knife is equivalent toTier 2Tech like theIron Knife, giving Prospectors the ability to skin larger animals, such asBuffaloandGrizzly Bears. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Shengong 'Shui' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Shengong 'Sichou' Knife.name: Shengong 'Sichou' Knife
Shengong 'Sichou' Knife.description: This knife and others, such as theShengong 'Qie' Knife, with the additional attribute that gives increased skinning yield actually has a 230% Yield from Skinning. This is because the additional attribute is multiplicative and not additive, making them better than theTitanium KnifeorInaris "Ventura" Knifeat skinning. UnlikeThrowing Knives, the Shengong 'Sichou' Knife cannot be thrown. There currently are no Workshop throwing knives.

Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe.name: Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe
Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe.description: The Shengong 'Sui Shi' Pickaxe is the Workshop equivalent of aSteel Pickaxe, allowing Prospectors to mine higher tier metals (Aluminium Ore,Platinum Ore, etc) at earlier stages of a Prospect while increasing yield.

Shengong 'Tetsuo' Hammer.name: Shengong 'Tetsuo' Hammer
Shengong 'Tetsuo' Hammer.description: Hammers are used to repairBuilding PiecesandDeployables. Hammers are also used to upgradeBuilding Pieces. In order to do so, the Prospector must have the building pieces in their inventory prior to upgrading. To select the building material, hold R while the Hammer is equipped and select a material from the radial wheel. Once the material is selected, right clicking on a building piece will upgrade it to the selected material if the building piece is currently in the Prospectors inventory.

Shengong UT5 Pickaxe.name: Shengong UT5 Pickaxe
Shengong UT5 Pickaxe.description: The Shengong UT5 Pickaxe is a Workshop Pickaxe geared towards combat, intrinsically dealing electric damage with the chance to significantly hinder targets. Since the Shengong UT5 Pickaxe has the same mining radius and yield as theLarkwell Martinez Pickaxe, Prospectors are better off using theInaris "Neves" Pickaxefor mining.

Shengong \"Xingxing\" Spear.name: Shengong "Xingxing" Spear
Shengong \"Xingxing\" Spear.description: The Shengong "Xingxing" Spear is unlocked in theWorkshopon theSpace Stationand is equipped in the Prospector's loadout before starting a new prospect.

Smoke Grenade.name: Smoke Grenade
Smoke Grenade.description: A smoke grenade is a canister-type grenade used as a signaling device, target or landing zone marking device, or as a screening device for unit movements. Upon detonation, the Smoke Grenade will cover the area in smoke and will obstruct the vision of creatures within the smoke.
